intro: Synaphea otiostigma, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a tropical plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, velvety hairs. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is native to regions in Central and South America, where it thrives in warm, humid climates. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
